p: Several potential underlying pathophysiological mechanisms were suggested, particularly for headaches in the forehead and periorbital regions [ 38]; notably, it could be due to a direct invasion of SARS-CoV-2 to the trigeminal nerve endings in the nasal cavity. The other proposed underlying mechanism is trigemino-vascular activation due to involvement of the endothelial cells of the vessel walls with high expression of angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2). A third proposed mechanism, the release of the pro-inflammatory mediators and cytokines during COVID-19 might stimulate the perivascular trigeminal nerve endings and cause headache.
